Title: Software Engineer (iOS and macOS) - Music
Job Description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton's Music team builds products and features for anything and everything related to music. We build tools for instructors, studios, and production teams to manage, select, play music, and construct workouts across all fields globally. We also provide internal music services globally.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON
Collaborate with the team that builds features for the Music Platform for both iOS and MacOS
Work with our product, design, and backend teams to identify and inform the platform elements required to support client-side features
Write code that is readable, maintainable, documented, and thoroughly tested
Evaluate and communicate engineering solutions and trade-offs to teammates and other, potentially non-technical teams
YOU BRING TO PELOTON
2+ years of experience
Familiarity with SwiftUI and UIKit (AppKit and Combine, are a plus)
Understanding of the concurrency APIs available on Apple's platforms
Experience developing integrations with RESTful APIs
Experience building component based UIs
Experience writing appropriate test coverage with XCTest
Understanding of modern architecture patterns like Model-View-View Model (MVVM)
Experience with Git
Experience shipping iOS applications
Knowledgeable around performance tuning, memory optimization, monitoring, and crash analysis
Experience with crash analysis and debugging tools
Familiarity with continuous build systems
BONUS
Experience with music or audio application development
Have worked in a Test Driven Development environment before
Have experience working in an Agile environment
Have OSS Project(s) or contribute to OSS communities
BENEFITS
As an organization, one of our top priorities is to maintain the health and wellbeing for our employees and their family. To achieve this goal, we offer robust and comprehensive benefits including:
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Generous paid time off policy
Short-term and long-term disability
Access to mental health services
401k, tuition reimbursement and student loan paydown plans
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Fertility and adoption support and up to 18 weeks of paid parental leave
Child care and family care discounts
Free access to Peloton Digital App and apparel and product discounts
Commuter benefits and Citi Bike Discount
Pet insurance and so much more!
#LI-RR1 #LI-Hybrid
ABOUT PELOTON:
Peloton is the leading interactive fitness platform globally, with a passionate community of nearly 7 million Members in the US, UK, Canada, Germany, and Australia. Peloton makes fitness entertaining, approachable, effective, and convenient, while fostering social connections that motivate its Members to commit to their fitness journeys. An innovator at the nexus of fitness, technology, and media, Peloton reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform that seamlessly combines the best equipment, proprietary networked software, world-class streaming digital fitness and wellness content, and best-in-class fitness experts and Instructors.
Peloton is an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our applicants. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request any accommodations from application through to interview, please email: applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com
Please be aware that fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers may be circulated on the Internet in an attempt to obtain privileged information, or to induce you to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training. Peloton does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted here on our careers page and all communications from the Peloton recruiting team and/or hiring managers will be from an @onepeloton.com email address.
If you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Peloton, please email applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.
Peloton does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Agencies should not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Peloton employees or any other organization location. Peloton is not responsible for any agency fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Software Engineer - Backend (Senior)
Job Description:
Indica Labs is looking for a highly talented and experienced developer to complement the Halo Infrastructure team who will be responsible for contributing to leading-edge digital pathology software. This position is in an exciting and emerging area of medicine that is critical in various fields, including cancer treatment research, drug trials, and development. The developers who work with Indica Labs get to directly contribute to the advancement of these medical applications while working for a company that has ranked first in "Top Places To Work" by the Albuquerque Journal two years in a row. Indica Labs also offers excellent benefits, including 100% paid medical insurance, flexible work style (remote, in-office, hybrid), annual bonuses, and a fully vested 401(k) matching. Indica Labs has a relaxed work culture where a healthy work-life balance is valued!

The exceptional developer hired for this position can impact how digital pathology is conducted across the world and to be of assistance to a variety of medical fields including cancer treatment research. The successful candidate needs to demonstrate a proven track record of working in a highly dynamic distributed team, and resolving complex issues in fast time with few issues using C#.

Special note to candidates: This posting includes full-time, temporary, and limited term options.
At this time, only candidates in New Mexico will be considered.

The Halo Infrastructure software development team is responsible for the following aspects of the application:
Large backend feature development.
Image viewing and analysis.
Back-end technology such as C#, GraphQL, Entity Framework, ASP.NET Core, and MySQL.
Large data set handling and manipulation.
Debugging and addressing reported software bugs.
Troubleshoot issues in complex, large-scale production deployments.
Develop highly performant applications and services.
and much more...

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (CS), Computer Engineering (CE), Electrical Engineering (EE), Math or related.
At least 5-8 years Software development experience.
Strong background in C#.
Experience with Full-Stack development.
Indica Labs is a Federal Contractor, so candidates within the United State should expect a requirement for full vaccination against COVID-19.
Authorization to work in the United States, or appropriate authorization to work in the applicant’s current home country (Indica Labs, Inc. does not sponsor work visas).

Title: Senior Full Stack Developer
Job Description:
Avery Products is looking for an experience Senior Full Stack Web Developer to work with our high-performance team developing designing and developing web applications that automate and optimize Avery Production using the latest technologies. The ideal candidate would have solid knowledge of web technologies, methodologies, and best practices. Work experience with Java Scrip (ES6+), NodeJs, Angular 2+ and Typescriptis big plus.
What we offer:
Dynamic, energetic work environment with an exceptional talented workforce.
Great comprehensive benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term & Long Term Disability, Company provided & paid life insurance
Excellent 401K Retirement Plan with generous company match.
Work Life Balance; 12 Company Paid Holidays, Paid Vacation and Paid Sick Time
Hybrid work week; 2 days in office with option to telecommute 3 days.
Responsibilities:
Design web applications based on business requirements and visual mockups
Work closely with developers to optimize and refine the user experience
Collaborate with team and business owners to define requirements
Research and propose innovative new features to existing systems and solutions to fine tune the production process.
Work with peers to continuously improve development process
Position Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other related field
Minimum 3 years hands on experience in developing interactive web applications.
Deep understanding of web technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6 or later ) and NodeJS ( or other web servers)
Experience with Angular 2+ and TypeScript is preferable.
Experience in responsive design and techniques is a plus
Experience with AWS Lambdas, DynamoDB and S3 is a big plus
Experience with Java is a plus
Experience with Microservices and Serverless Architecture is a big plus
Passion for solving complex problems
Strong communication skills
Energetic, self-starter and self motivated
Effective in a team environment
Avery Products Corporation, is a wholly owned subsidiary of CCL Industries, is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of self-adhesive labels, labeling software, binders, dividers and other products. Founded in 1935, Avery has built a solid reputation as the trusted brand and leading resource for organization and identification solutions. Combining dynamic capabilities in technology with groundbreaking ideas, Avery offers innovative products to make life easier—at work, home, school, and small business. Avery also offers free software, design templates and mobile apps. The consumer can now access the Avery experience anywhere, anytime and create customized projects that are uniquely their own.
All offers of employment are based on the successful completion of a pre-employment background check. Avery Products Corporation is an at-will employer. Employment is at will and, as such, are free to resign at any time without any reason. The company retains the right to terminate an employee’s employment at any time with or without reason or notice.
Thank you for your time and consideration of this opportunity. Please include resume when responding.

Title: Senior Front End Developer
Job Description:
Here at Spectrum, our Front End Developers create websites and software tools that generate leads for our small- to medium-sized client companies throughout North America and we are looking for bright and creative individuals to create clever and inviting sites and tools that will set our clients and our team apart from our competitors. If you are a self-motivated individual, eager to grow in a position that appreciates artistry as much as functionality and creativity, then read on to learn how Spectrum can give you the skills and environment you need to create your masterpiece.
Responsibilities
As a Front End Developer at Spectrum and ultimately our bridge between visual designers, back end developers, and all things marketing you will be:
Designing and building responsive websites in Bootstrap
Building user interfaces for a multitude of innovative SaaS and AI learning tools for Spectrum’s software tools
Designing and developing the interface of mobile applications
Creating custom solutions for our software tool platforms
Build responsive web tools and seamlessly integrate motion into our website interfaces utilizing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Working alongside designers, production experts, web developers, and creative professionals to develop lasting solutions for Spectrum clients
Some Characteristics That Define You
As a Front End Developer, you know that your job is much more than graphic design, web development, or creative alone. You are an artist, an engineer, and multitude of other things which make you the stellar developer that you are. As such, here are just a few traits that define our Front End Developers here at Spectrum:
Developers. Design is a unique opportunity to combine the artistry and creativity of the web with the functionality and logic of a scientist and an inventor. Our front-end developers are design engineers just as much as they are artists.
Detail-Oriented. White space and themed projects are some of our best friends in the design and development department. We love to see a site come perfectly together and we know you hate to see tiny details and bad Photoshop jobs ruin a beautiful project.
Visionaries. One of the things we love about design here at Spectrum is that it’s constantly evolving. Whether you are working on a new internal software platform or innovative new client site, we are always looking for ways to improve our products and increase your knowledge base as a developer.
Curious. As developers and digital marketers, we have the unique opportunity to create interactive and functional pieces of art. As developers, we’re not only proud of those projects but curious why some are more successful than others and seek to understand which designs work best.
Business-Savvy. Beyond the wicked front end development skills you bring to the table, we also want you to consider the business implications of our websites and software tools. From the ways our team will use them to how our clients and their customers will interact with our sites, we always want you to keep the user and the business application in mind.
Required Skills and Experience
As a Front End Developer at Spectrum, you will have the ability to hone your craft and advance your core skillset; but before we can do that, here are just a few of the skills and experience you should have coming in:
A bachelor’s degree/pursuing a bachelor's degree in design, computer science, information, or a related field
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience with HTML and CSS
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience with Javascript/JQuery
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience in desktop, mobile and responsive web design
Experience/familiarity with .Net/MVC/Razor and Microsoft Azure
Ability to explain and translate your work to those under you as well as in different departments
Acute eye for detail
Benefits
Being the dynamite Front End Developer that you are, we understand that in order to get the creative juices flowing you need a good work-life-play balance. To make sure that’s possible this full-time position comes with a highly competitive salary and unparalleled benefits including:
Comprehensive medical & dental insurance
Retirement planning & company matching
Generous PTO, including sick days & holidays
A state-of-the-art office environment
Nintendo Switch in-office gaming such as FIFA, Arms, Mario Kart, and Rocket League
Year-round gym memberships
Paid continuing education
Casual dress code
Flexible scheduling
Free-Lunch-Friday
Company sponsored parties and group activities outside of the office
About Us
Our company mission can be summed up in one word—growth. At Spectrum, our top priorities revolve around growing business for our customers, growing our software, and growing our careers.
Since opening our doors in 1992, Spectrum has proudly served the small and medium-sized business owner, developing new and innovative ways to drive sales for their businesses. Today, we work with more than 1000 clients in virtually every major North American market serving as one of the nation’s top lead generation software and service providers in the home services arena. But Spectrum is so much more than just a service for lead generation and lead generation software.
Spectrum is a manifestation of our team’s ingenuity and unique skillset. The talent of our individual team members and energy as a unit has led us to create the program responsible for our overall success. This lead generation ecosystem, combining a multitude of software tools, full-service account management, and web-development processes has secured millions of leads for our clients and is a true testament to the capabilities and forward-thinking attitude of the Spectrum family.
With our headquarters in downtown Chicago, we continue to grow every day as a leader and innovator in driving client sales, and we want you to join us in doing so.
Apply for our Front End Developer position and feel your impact with Spectrum today!
INDSPCI

Title: Senior ReactJS Developer
Job Description:
Infosys is seeking a Senior ReactJS Developer. This position will interface with key stakeholders and apply your technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including Requirements Elicitation, Application Architecture definition and Design. You will play an important role in creating the high level design artifacts. You will also deliver high quality code deliverables for a module, lead validation for all types of testing and support activities related to implementation, transition and warranty. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
At least 4 years of Information Technology experience.
Experience with ReactJS skill.
U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply, we are unable to sponsor at this time.
Candidate must be located in Bridgewater, NJ or be willing to relocate to the state. This position may require travel to project locations.
Preferred Qualifications:
At least 2 years of experience with Javascript, Angular JS, React JS
At least 2 years of experience with React.js, Redux, Node.js, HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, Node.js, AJAX, REST based APIs, git, github, SOAP, SaSS/LeSS, SQL/NoSQL, etc.
React Native, microservices, docker containerization, angular 2/4, Java, MS.Net, PHP, etc.
At least 2 years of experience in Project life cycle activities on development and maintenance projects.
At least 2 years of experience in Design and architecture review.
At least 2 years of experience in project execution in a technical role. Should have been involved in hands-on coding as well as architecture role.
At least 5 years of experience in technology consulting, enterprise and solutions architecture and architectural frameworks
Experience in defining new architectures and ability to drive an independent project from an architectural stand point
Analytical skills
Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment

The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face. Travel may be required as per the job requirements.
About Us
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation.
With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
To learn more about Infosys and see our ideas in action please visit us at www.Infosys.com
Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, spouse of protected veteran, or disability.

Title: Engineer - Automation Controls
Location: Petrotech, Inc. in New Orleans, LA 70123
Job Description:
Position Summary: Under the supervision of Project Lead, the Automation Controls Engineer is responsible for the complete design and implementation of industrial automation projects in accordance with customer specifications and industry requirements. This position is responsible for the technical execution of assigned projects and will assist with development of project schedules, budgets, and timelines.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
· Development of all elements of an industrial automation system, such as: I/O list, Cause & Effect Diagrams, control panel design, network architecture, electrical schematics, mechanical design & calculations, etc. as required by the project scope.
· Configuration, programming and testing of the PLC/HMI/Data Acquisition applications as necessary to safely operate the system.
· Selection and procurement of materials for the control system, including panel components, field instrumentation and electrical equipment. Review Vendor data to ensure specifications and project requirements are met.
· Preparation of project documentation including Factory and Site Acceptance Test Protocols, Operations Manuals, and Functional Design Specifications.
· Perform tests to demonstrate to customer hardware and software compliance to control system drawings/specifications.
· Development and Implementation of customer training programs.
· Interface effectively with other engineering functions, project management, procurement, sales/proposals, panel shop and field personnel.
· Participate in project meetings and represent Petrotech in technical discussions with customers and vendors.
· Loop checks and startup assistance in accordance with Health, Safety, Environmental and Quality systems.
Job Qualifications:
· BS Degree in engineering or a technical field with 3 years of automation experience; or 5 years hands on in Industrial automation design and commissioning.
· Experience in automation systems networking, HMI and data acquisition is a significant plus.
· Some rotating machinery experience preferred.
Working Conditions:
· Location: Houston or New Orleans.
· Typical office environment with some travel for commissioning or testing at industrial work sites, such as gas pipeline or processing stations, power plants or refineries.
· Up to 15% travel is expected.

Pay: $70,000.00 - $125,642.41 per year

Title: Software Developer
Job Description:
We are currently seeking a Full-Stack Software Developer to join our industry-leading team. We are a rapidly growing entrepreneurial company with massive upside opportunities. The ideal candidate should be able to work independently and as part of a team to deliver high-quality products.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Node.js: The ideal candidate should have in-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with Node.js. They should be familiar with the Express framework, its packages, APIs, and releases. They should also be well-versed with NPM and NVM.
Production Released Work tools: The candidate should have experience with various programming languages such as GoLang, Python, and Bash/Shell Scripting. They should have a good understanding of GRPC (Go/Javascript), ProtoBuf, Electron, and be familiar with various databases such as MongoDB, Firebase, ArangoDB, and Redis. They should also have experience with cloud services like AWS and Digital Ocean and be familiar with HAProxy and Nats. The ideal candidate should also have experience developing iOS/Mobile Applications and Android Applications.
Graphic Skills: The ideal candidate should have experience with graphic design tools such as Sketch (Mac), Photoshop, Illustrator, and SVG.• Production Used Web Frameworks: The ideal candidate should have experience with front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, Svelte, and Vue.js.
Desired Additional Skills: The candidate should have experience with infrastructure as code tools like Terraform and Ansible. They should also have experience with programming languages like Elixir/Phoenix, Swift, Dart, and Balerina, and Java.
Operating System Requirements: The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years of experience developing on a Mac.
Development Production Tools: The ideal candidate should be proficient in using Jet Brains tools such as Webstorm, GoLand, and PyCharm. They should also have moderate experience using VS Code and Git.Ensure enforcement of information security best practices to maintain network integrity.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree required from accredited university; Computer Science or Computer Information Systems preferred.
Minimum of five (5) years’ experience in managing/ administering complex Cisco networks
Minimum of three (3) years hands on lab experience trialing networking components, features, and systems.

Title: Software Developer
Job Description:
About Harmony Venture Labs
At HVL, we believe that technology platforms can and should be used to benefit people and their communities. New venture creation is a powerful vehicle to deliver those benefits. We are drawn to big ideas and bold founders to bring their ideas to life.
Harmony Venture Labs (HVL) is a venture studio led by a team of experienced founders and experts who launch startups, grow our portfolio of brands, support SaaS entrepreneurs and invest in our people and community. We believe that technology platforms should be used to benefit people and their communities and that new venture creation is a powerful vehicle to deliver value. We help our companies navigate their journey to faster, sustainable growth through strategy, marketing, design, and product guidance.
Overview
Harmony Venture Labs (HVL) is a Birmingham-based venture studio that brings together talented teams to build high-growth startups and drive economic growth. We are looking for talented, driven, and entrepreneurially-minded software developers to partner with our entrepreneurs to build software solutions.
We're looking for a software developer who is starting out their developer journey and loves hacking and building with technology. This could be the perfect fit if you are interested in building zero-to-one products and fast-tracking your entrepreneurship knowledge. You will work side-by-side with entrepreneurs to make products from the ground up and contribute to the fast-growing tech scene in Birmingham.
Tech Stack
The tech stack will vary based on the product, but in general, you can expect the following:
JS + Design: We will use Node.JS, Koa, Typescript, and React. A great sense of design and attention to detail will be a huge plus.
Scale and ship fast: Help us quickly scale, monitor, and ship changes. We work with ExpressJS/KoaJS, Postgres/MongoDB, AWS, Google Cloud, and Kafka for most of our portfolio companies.
Responsibilities
Working with the design team to establish the feasibility of the product features.
Owning the initial development and engineering for HVL's next company.
Communicating and making engineering decisions regarding the product.
Working closely with the HVL engineering and design teams to build, test, and ship the product.
Maintaining the product from the initial release and optimizing for scale as the customer base grows.
Work closely with the Entrepreneur-in-Residence to interview customers and make data-driven product decisions based on customer research.
What You Bring
Experience creating applications with React and Node or similar Javascript frameworks
A passion for building software from the ground up. We love to see side projects.
RESTful API integration or development experience
Experience with Javascript frameworks (we mainly use Node.js, Nextjs, and React)
Experience working with database systems (e.g., Postgres, MongoDB)
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Entrepreneurially minded: Be able to design and scale unique technology or products, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are passionate about building intuitive products.
Scrappy and self-motivated — show us any side projects you're building (non-technical efforts welcomed!)
Stellar communication skills with the ability to lead technical discussions.
Minimum Requirements
Experience or degree in relevant field including Computer Science, Engineering or a similar field
Experience developing web-based software, especially software as a service type applications
Proficiency in programming languages and frameworks such as React, NodeJs and other modern technology development tools. Knowledge of languages such as Python are a huge plus.
Experience with continuous integration, and deployment tools
Experience with data persistence solutions such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills
Ability to learn quickly and work independently or as part of a team

What We Value
Relentlessly Innovate: We embrace curiosity in everything we do.
Keep Things Simple: We recognize perfection can be a roadblock to progress.
Default To Action: We are empowered to make decisions without certainty.
Embrace Flexibility: We view change as an opportunity instead of a challenge.
Benefits
Equity incentives in each new company HVL launches
Unlimited PTO
Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental, and vision
Monthly learning stipend
Annual remote office stipend
Monthly wellness stipend
Harmony Venture Labs provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Software Developer
Job Description:
Overview:
Turn 5 is one of the largest and fastest growing e-commerce retailers in the Greater Philadelphia area. Best known for our award-winning e-commerce platforms, AmericanMuscle.com, ExtremeTerrain.com and AmericanTrucks.com, we’ve been engaging car enthusiasts with exceptional products, services, and experiences since 2004.

Our purpose, however, extends beyond selling car parts. We have a commitment to creating meaningful customer experiences at every step of their journey. Whether it’s supplying a unique product that customizes the look and feel of their ride, providing thousands of educational videos for the DIYer or leveraging user generated content to inspire even the most experienced owner, we are obsessed with ensuring we reach as many like-minded gearheads across the globe.

To continue our growth path, we need a Software Developer to provision, install/configure, maintain and monitor all mission critical systems at Turn5. In this position, you will be the escalation point for more complicated Help Desk tickets, as well as providing mentoring to others on the team.
The Software Developer is responsible for development tasks related to the e-commerce websites, supporting services, and related applications. Individual will work through the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) to complete work in a timely manner and adhere to business goals. Mentorship of other team members will be required from time to time. This position reports directly to the Lead Software Developer
Responsibilities:
Year 1 is going to be about:

New development and support of current and future e-commerce applications and systems, related service integrations, and other projects as assigned.
Will work directly with other internal departments / third party resources or services as needed.
Clear and constructive communication with colleagues, project managers, and management – with varying levels of technical proficiency – to capture requirements, expectations, and provide status.
Adeptness to “own” projects through completion and continually maintain responsibility.
Backend-focused full stack development
Qualifications:
We can’t skip over some of the specific skills and experience we know are a “must” to be successful. So, we need you to have:
4+ years of recent experience with C# ASP.NET development, e-commerce experience preferred. Portfolio of prior relevant work and/or skills testing may be required.
Solid understanding of .NET 4.5, MVC 4 / 5, REST APIs, SQL Server, Unit Tests, and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts.
Proficiency with C#, ASP.NET 4.5 or later, MVC 4.0 or later, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, REST, JSON, XML and SQL Databases (T-SQL, creating rational database models and stored procedures)
Visual Studio 2015 or later
Very knowledgeable of coding efficiencies and best practices in object-oriented programming
Experience in working with caching systems and coding practices utilizing cached objects
Adept with the SDLC methodology in an Agile environment – planning, estimates, documentation, development, testing, and deployment
Understanding of CI/CD processes
Problem-solving skills debugging, tracing and performance testing applications

Knowledge of the following technologies/software is a plus:
React
React-Native
.NET Core
Couchbase
Elasticsearch
Microservices

Title: Software Developer - Entry Level
Job Description:
Urban League is looking for a passionate, experienced Software Engineer who thrives in a highly collaborative, team environment. The right candidate will have significant experience mentoring and coaching agile development teams towards achieving the organization's goals. As the Software Developer, you will lead and manage all members of the software development team and focus on developing the people and processes that make Urban League a great place to work.

Responsibilities

As a Software Engineer, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on high performing, high throughput multi-threaded applications and will need very good problem-solving and debugging skills, and come up with strategies to solve them. You will be part of a self-organizing team where architecting, designing and implementation of system enhancements are collectively determined and implemented along with QA engineers:

Architect, design and implement features/enhancements as needed by the business.
Perform analysis and improve performance and throughput of the systems.
Identify bottlenecks, problems, and come up with strategies to resolve them.
Identify and implement solutions for automated monitoring of the systems.
Make improvements in the applications so that it needs lesser manual intervention and facilitates automated monitoring and correcting problems.
Perform system maintenance and application deployments on a regular basis.
Identify bottlenecks and problems in the architecture and suggest strategies to improve.
Experience and Skills

Excellent, demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to work well in a small team environment.
Good aptitude to provide support to business users of the system.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies.
Benefits
Competitive salary - $125,000-$145,000/year
Comp-time and flexible work hours
Full health, life, disability, and dental insurance
Retirement plan with company contribution
Annual company profit sharing
Personal development/training budget
Open, collaborative work environment
Company provided refreshments

Title: Senior Software Certification Engineer - Aviation Compliance Specialist
Location: 9735 Landmark Parkway Dr, St. Louis, MO 63127
Job Description:
Overview:
We are seeking a full-time Senior Software Certification Engineer for our St. Louis location. In this role, you will be responsible for providing leadership and planning for software certification tasks carried out by Aviation SQA/Support team including document creation, software process auditing and potentially data approval, in support of TSO authorization of product.
Responsibilities:
Essential Functions
Audit TSO project data to ensure compliance with internal Garmin processes and FAA reglations such that RTCA DO-178B/C requirements are met.
Audit Type 2 LOA data to ensure compliance with internal Garmin processes and FAA regulations such that RCTA DO-200 and DO-200B requirements are met.
Support internal and external audits by certification authorities.
Work with industry and certification authorities to develop new and change existing standards related to article certification such as TSO.
Interface directly with certification authorities at times.
Maintain knowledge and collaborate with industry and certification authorities on developments in and best practice for the implementation of DO-178 compliance.
Mentor future candidates for Garmin Aviation Compliance Specialists.
Actively encourage collaboration and professionalism in a team environment with other Garmin associates and customers to achieve goals
Make substantial contributions to certification of software products
Provides technical input to certification plan and completion documents
Provides reliable solutions to a wide range of difficult problems including evaluation of new technologies to improve existing functions
Demonstrates broad understanding of Garmin’s business model including Engineering, Operations, Finance, Sales & Marketing
Serves as a mentor to less experienced Software Certification Engineers/Analysts (Software Certification Engineering or Analyst 1 & 2)
Gives and receives feedback in a constructive manner
Exemplifies Garmin’s Mission, Vision, Values and Quality Policy and proactively works to improve Garmin’s image and culture
Qualifications:
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Management Information Systems or related field AND a minimum of 5 years relevant experience OR an equivalent combination of education and experience
Excellent academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0 as a general rule)
Demonstrated proven track record in successfully executing projects of any scale or complexity
Must be positive, detail oriented, organized, team oriented and a driven problem solver, multi-tasker, and self-starter with the ability to prioritize and lead in a fast paced, deadline-driven environment
Desired Qualifications
Demonstrates proficient knowledge of Garmin product lines, customers, processes and procedures
Demonstrates proficient understanding of RTCA DO-178B/DO-178C process and working knowledge of other regulatory guidance for aviation software
Past or current Software DER for RTCA DO-178B/DO-178C or equivalent role in TSO compliance finding for software

Garmin International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran’s status, age or disability.

Title: Software Developer
Job Description:
About Harmony Venture Labs
At HVL, we believe that technology platforms can and should be used to benefit people and their communities. New venture creation is a powerful vehicle to deliver those benefits. We are drawn to big ideas and bold founders to bring their ideas to life.
Harmony Venture Labs (HVL) is a venture studio led by a team of experienced founders and experts who launch startups, grow our portfolio of brands, support SaaS entrepreneurs and invest in our people and community. We believe that technology platforms should be used to benefit people and their communities and that new venture creation is a powerful vehicle to deliver value. We help our companies navigate their journey to faster, sustainable growth through strategy, marketing, design, and product guidance.
Overview
Harmony Venture Labs (HVL) is a Birmingham-based venture studio that brings together talented teams to build high-growth startups and drive economic growth. We are looking for talented, driven, and entrepreneurially-minded software developers to partner with our entrepreneurs to build software solutions.
We're looking for a software developer who is starting out their developer journey and loves hacking and building with technology. This could be the perfect fit if you are interested in building zero-to-one products and fast-tracking your entrepreneurship knowledge. You will work side-by-side with entrepreneurs to make products from the ground up and contribute to the fast-growing tech scene in Birmingham.
Tech Stack
The tech stack will vary based on the product, but in general, you can expect the following:
JS + Design: We will use Node.JS, Koa, Typescript, and React. A great sense of design and attention to detail will be a huge plus.
Scale and ship fast: Help us quickly scale, monitor, and ship changes. We work with ExpressJS/KoaJS, Postgres/MongoDB, AWS, Google Cloud, and Kafka for most of our portfolio companies.
Responsibilities
Working with the design team to establish the feasibility of the product features.
Owning the initial development and engineering for HVL's next company.
Communicating and making engineering decisions regarding the product.
Working closely with the HVL engineering and design teams to build, test, and ship the product.
Maintaining the product from the initial release and optimizing for scale as the customer base grows.
Work closely with the Entrepreneur-in-Residence to interview customers and make data-driven product decisions based on customer research.
What You Bring
Experience creating applications with React and Node or similar Javascript frameworks
A passion for building software from the ground up. We love to see side projects.
RESTful API integration or development experience
Experience with Javascript frameworks (we mainly use Node.js, Nextjs, and React)
Experience working with database systems (e.g., Postgres, MongoDB)
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Entrepreneurially minded: Be able to design and scale unique technology or products, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are passionate about building intuitive products.
Scrappy and self-motivated — show us any side projects you're building (non-technical efforts welcomed!)
Stellar communication skills with the ability to lead technical discussions.
Minimum Requirements
Experience or degree in relevant field including Computer Science, Engineering or a similar field
Experience developing web-based software, especially software as a service type applications
Proficiency in programming languages and frameworks such as React, NodeJs and other modern technology development tools. Knowledge of languages such as Python are a huge plus.
Experience with continuous integration, and deployment tools
Experience with data persistence solutions such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills
Ability to learn quickly and work independently or as part of a team

What We Value
Relentlessly Innovate: We embrace curiosity in everything we do.
Keep Things Simple: We recognize perfection can be a roadblock to progress.
Default To Action: We are empowered to make decisions without certainty.
Embrace Flexibility: We view change as an opportunity instead of a challenge.
Benefits
Equity incentives in each new company HVL launches
Unlimited PTO
Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental, and vision
Monthly learning stipend
Annual remote office stipend
Monthly wellness stipend
Harmony Venture Labs provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Software Engineer Apprentice
Job Description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Are you interested in pursuing a software development career? Have you heard about agile development, but want to learn more about how it ‘works’? Are you someone that has a foundational understanding of development or programming concepts, but want to take a less traditional path to achieve it?

What is an Apprenticeship?
IBM Apprenticeship Program, which lasts approximately 12 months, is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL). Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.

During the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 12 months. Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.

Who You Are
An apprenticeship is about learning. We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just getting your career started, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow. If you’ve had some experience with coding or development in the past, you’re exactly the type of candidate we’re looking for….
Drive and eagerness to learn
Strong problem solving and communication skills
Able to work independently and take initiative, as well as work collaboratively and contribute to an agile team environment
Some knowledge or experience in ONE or more of the following:
Java, JavaScript, PHP, C#, Objective-C, C/C++, Python, Ruby and/or functional languages (Haskell, Scala, F#, Clojure)
Design Thinking
Hypothesis driven development
Social coding
Agile principles
Container development using tools such as Docker or Vagrant
Application Development, DevOps automation, and the development toolchain (e.g. Travis, Jenkins, Junit, automated test tools)
What’s the Experience?
As an apprentice, you'll join with other apprentices in a local cohort. You'll go through your first few weeks together, learning about IBM and the skills you'll be attaining throughout your apprenticeship. Then, you'll work with your managers and mentors to progress through your personal skills roadmap, learning and demonstrating new knowledge and competencies through hands-on application with your project teams. You'll complete milestones along the way, earning digital credentials to validate your skills, and will come back together with other apprentices to participate in on-going training and development focused on your professional and technical skills.

As a Software Engineer Apprentice at IBM, you’ll work as part of a larger team of experienced developers and mentors in an interactive, collaborative environment. You’ll learn the fundamentals of development, software design, testing, and cloud computing, agile principles, IBM Design Thinking, DevOps and continuous delivery. You will also learn how to resolve IBM customer issues, debug customer problems and environments, and increase Cloud Service skills, and will build the skills to grow your career as a Software Developer. Best of all, you are a contributing member of your team, putting forward ideas, taking on responsibilities and making choices about how you get the job done just like any other IBMer.

The work location for this position is San Jose, CA. Must be local or willing to relocate at own expense. No relocation is available for this position.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Must have basic knowledge in one of the following programming languages: Java, JavaScript, PHP, C#, Objective-C, C/C++, Python, Ruby and/or functional languages (Haskell, Scala, F#, Clojure)
Willingness to complete the requirements of the apprenticeship program.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
none

About Business Unit
IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.
This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM offers a competitive benefits program which may include medical & prescription drug coverage, dental, vision, mental health & well being, 8 paid holidays, minimum 56 hours paid sick time, 80 hours paid vacation, life insurance, 401(k), financial counseling, and the IBM Employee Stock Purchase Plan. IBM offers paid family medical leave and disability benefits to eligible employees where required by applicable law.

The compensation range and benefits for this position are based on a full-time schedule for a full calendar year. The salary will vary depending on your job-related skills, experience and location. Pay increment and frequency of pay will be in accordance with employment classification and applicable laws. For part time roles, your compensation and benefits will be adjusted to reflect your hours. Benefits may be pro-rated for those who start working during the calendar year.

IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Producer
Job Description:
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is in search of a multi-talented Producer to join our studio with an existing team of artists, programmers, and designers in creating “cutting edge” Virtual Reality (VR) and PC advanced training for the United States Air Force. Our client is a visionary leader that is bringing VR and digital training to the forefront of Air Force technical and specialty training for Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) analyst and operators around the world. This is a unique opportunity to leverage your proven industry experience to create realistic and immersive simulations for U.S. Air Force training.
As a Producer, you will manage the day-to-day production and development of photorealistic digital assets optimized to run in real time modern game engines for PC and VR applications. You will adhere to standard industry best practices and work closely with all disciplines to help resolve development issues, enable workflow through collaboration, track schedules, burn downs, and prioritize tasks, to deliver high quality results. You will collaborate with an experienced Senior Program Manager to plan and execute immersive modeling and simulation training. You will be required to facilitate full-scale production of synthetic environments and digital models that include but is not limited to military aircraft, weapons, vehicles, communication equipment, environmental elements (trees, sky, water, landscapes etc.), buildings/structures, and characters. Attention to detail and the ability to replicate real world operations is key to achieving our customers’ requirements. This is an opportunity to apply your task management skills with a company that is creating innovative training solutions for the US Air force.
Responsibilities:
Support project manager and own the project, empowering the studio development team to reach success.
Coordinate daily stand-ups, meeting schedules, track conversation via notes and create action items.
Master the project schedule. Work with leadership to build and maintain project schedules.
Identify and mitigate project risk.
Exemplify professionalism, provide excellent verbal and written communication.
Provide development team solid tasking through deep understanding of the project delivery goals.
Qualifications:
6+ years of direct experience in a production role, managing cross-functional teams in the creation of video games, modeling, and simulation training for commercial or Defense industry.
Bachelor’s degree OR experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
Production experience utilizing Unreal Engine in marketing, film, video game, or Defense industry.
Exceptional organization skills. Must be able to decipher military training manuals and military equipment technical orders (such as military aircraft) into project tasks for cross functional development team.
Deep understanding of game development process and terminology used by various disciplines.
Ability to collaborate with Senior Project Managers on project scope, design, methodology and support product quality control as directed.
Direct working experience with JIRA or similar software for both task tracking and scrum boards.
Strong experience with Microsoft Suite. Experience with Microsoft Project is a plus.
Understand game development, simulation fundamentals and balance production tasks against business requirements.
Strong understanding of traditional software development process and agile methodology. Be able to create custom approach to solve unique problem sets.
Must be able to conduct VR functional/play testing quality assessments and provide detailed written feedback and redirect production team for rework as needed.
Problem solver who continuously applies risk management and mitigation techniques to keep project on schedule and moving forward.
Ability to act as a stakeholder and own the quality and integrity of each software deliverable.
Strong work ethic that strives for continuous process improvement and production efficiency.
Ability to operate in a dynamic cross-functional environment in a 100% remote working environment.
Ability to obtain security clearance (requires US citizenship).
Travel up to 5% is possible.
Nice to Have:
Experience as digital artist or game or general software developer.
Prior military experience is helpful to understanding the unique aspects of military training.
Experience presenting or marketing products to large audiences or dignitaries.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $59,150.00 - $91,000.00 - $122,850.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Title: Programmer
Location: Unicorr Packaging Group in North Haven, CT 06473
Job Description:
We are seeking a dedicated SQL programmer to join our growing company. You will work as part of a broader team to design and create database structures suitable for quickly and efficiently storing and retrieving relevant data for company projects.
As an SQL programmer, you will be expected to develop fast and performant database queries, in addition to performing database maintenance tasks and ensuring an even load distribution as required. Your duties will include following best database design and development practices, as well as staying up-to-date with all relevant data security procedures and complying with all applicable data protection legislation.
Responsibilities
Below are some of the responsibilities an SQL developer or programmer is expected to assume in their position:
Write fast and performant database queries using a flavor of SQL Server, such as MySQL, MSSQL, or PostgreSQL
Troubleshooting and problem-solving using JavaScript and other programming languages
Maintain and back up databases regularly
Perform SQL database sharding and indexing procedures as required to handle heavy traffic loads
Development, optimize, and implement stored procedures
Use database analytical tools to analyze performance and generate reports
Job Qualifications and Skill Sets
10 years of experience as a SQL Developer or similar role
Bachelor’s degree in software development, computer science, business intelligence, information technology, data management, or other related fields
Advanced knowledge of database procedures and Microsoft SQL Server concepts
Advanced knowledge of one or more SQL variant, such as MySQL, MSSQL, and PostgreSQL
The ability to create fast and efficient database queries, including joining and cross-referencing cells from several tables
Familiarity with standard database management tools and software, such as Microsoft Access, Oracle Database, and phpMyAdmin
Familiarity with Businedd Intelligence software such as Cognos, Qlikview, etc
Excellent understanding of Microsoft SQL Server
Good knowledge of HTML and JavaScript
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements
Research required data
Build appropriate and useful reporting deliverables
Analyze existing SQL queries for performance improvements
Suggest new queries
Develop procedures and scripts for data migration
Provide timely scheduled management reporting
Any experience with KiwiPlan would be a huge bonus.
Understanding of data networks, PC networking and communications is a plus
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on company’s success
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Team player
Good time-management skills
Great interpersonal and communication skills
For additional information on Unicorr Packaging Group, please visit our website at www.unicorr.com.
Unicorr Packaging Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplace.
All qualified applicants to Unicorr Packaging Group will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law

Title: Senior Web Developer (Angular & .NET) - Remote
Job Description:
About us
RedRock Software is headquartered in Las Vegas, NV with remote team members throughout the United States and Asia. We were founded by hospitality technology experts with the goal to provide a modern and integrated supply chain management (SCM) software system.
RedRock Software’s revolutionary product is a web-based, supply chain management system, providing full "source to pay" for hospitality operators. The SCM tool provides Strategic Sourcing, E-procurement, Materials Management, Supplier Relationship Management, and Cost Analysis, all in a single, integrated solution.
RedRock Software offers a competitive salary, medical benefits, paid time off, and flexible schedules.
Our company is seeking an experienced Senior Web Developer to join our team in a remote capacity. The ideal candidate will have a strong history of working with Angular Framework and .NET, with a passion for creating dynamic and engaging web applications.
Responsibilities:
Develop high-quality, responsive web applications using Angular Framework and .NET
Work closely with product management and UX/UI designers to create engaging user experiences
Collaborate with back-end developers to ensure seamless integration with server-side components
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code
Conduct code reviews and provide feedback to other team members
Continuously improve and learn new technologies to ensure the best possible solutions are provided
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
At least 5 years of experience in web development with a strong focus on Angular Framework and .NET
Excellent understanding of front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience with RESTful APIs, JSON, and Web Services
Strong experience with Git version control
Familiarity with Agile software development methodology
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently in a remote environment as well as part of a team
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with opportunities for professional development and growth. If you are a passionate and skilled web developer looking for your next challenge, please submit your resume and portfolio.
